column5: Hi--I am looking to buy a St. Croix Legend Elite, 6'10" one-piece rod. On my fly in's, I always bring 2-piece rods, for ease of transportation, etc. What do you think is the best rod case for a long, one-piece rod like this, if I want to take it with next summer? I did a search on Cabela's site, but didn't really get a good sense of what to go with. Thanks for any advice!

I've got a Flambeau Bazuka rod case. It's adjustable out to about 8 feet. I put one and 2 piece rods in it. Works well for me. I stuff some newspaper in once all the rods are in just to keep them from bouncing around.

Buy the case from St Croix off their website that matches the rod. I have 4 different sizes of their cases. Work great and price is right. 30 -50$http://stcroixrods.com/shop/rods-cases-sacks/I think the 6'10" fits best in this one: RC86 I use them for multiple trips a year and have never had to replace them going on 8+ years.Brett

I bought this one for my one piece rods and after two trips I am very happy with ithttp://www.planomolding.com/fishing/...rod-tube-largeI have had 5 rods in it with no problems - longest would be 7 feetCheersGordy
Didn't know that! I only live an hour or so from Park Falls, so I am going to check this out. Thanks!!

The factory is pretty non-descript but interesting to watch them make the rods. But now you know where it is shopping there can be a little addictive. I stop when I have time and just browse to see if I can figure out what makes the rod a "second". Sometimes it is the smallest and insignificant thing. Great prices too.

Go to Menards. 1- 4 " green drain line X 10' Lg 1- 4" cap 1- 4" threaded end. 1- 4" threaded cap. Cut pipe to desired length. Glue both caps. Will fit 5-6 spinning rods with reels removed. Total cost about $20.
Its all about weight. I use a 4 inch Plano that extends to 8 feet and we can get 10 rods in it and its 4 lbs empty. been using it for years works good. Halfmoon
It may not apply in your case, but sometimes the size of your aircraft will dictate the length of rod case for your trip. 2 or 3 fishermen riding a skywagon might go with 2 piece rods.
